Description: One fragment of a reconstructed North Ionian pottery plate, probably a standed plate as reconstructed. Eleven fragments in all, joining to six. Upturned rim; poorly fired in places. Decorated inside and out. Outside, running dog between bands at rim; friezes below separated by bands with added red band lined in white; above, lotus and bud frieze with incision and red hearts; running dog; animal frieze with thick filling ornament, variously preserved: rear of lion and large bird on two sets of fragments; boar to left; part of floral; below, running dog and frieze of lotus-palmettes and buds. Inside, with same dividing bands; running dog at rim, animal frieze facing in below: to left, bull and lion with raised paw and grazing goat; lion followed by bird; grazing goat and lion; further animal frieze below: to left, lion's rear and panther, paw raised; sphinx; panther; at centre, dark ground with incised lotus-palmettes and buds.
Curator's comments: Joined with 1886,0401.1082 and 1888,0601.538a and four other sherds of that sequence, probably including b and c.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.740)
